isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - DISASSEMBLE - SHORT SERIES PISTONS

step1.para: Remove the piston plug. The plug is locked to the piston with a 1/8 inch soft pin. Use a 5/64 inch drill to drill out the pin ( Figure 29).

note.para: The top adjusting nut, which is exposed, should never be removed or the reference to the valve center is lost ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Never Remove Top Adjusting Nut

step1.para: Use a spanner wrench to remove the piston plug from the piston ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Remove Piston Plug From Piston

note.para: The spanner wrench shown here can be fabricated using a piece of flat stock with two bolts bolted in place with the proper spacing to fit the piston plug.

step1.para: The seals on the piston plug can be removed and discarded if replacement is required ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Remove Seals on Piston Plug

step1.para: Mark the top adjustment nut and piston so that the nut can be re-installed in its original position ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Mark Top Adjustment Nut and Piston

warning.para: Misadjustment of the top adjustment nut could cause erratic steering.

step1.para: Use a 5/64 inch drill to drill out the adjusting nut lock pin. A piece of stock material is used to turn the adjusting nut out of the piston ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Turn Adjusting Nut Out of Piston

step1.para: Carefully slide the control valve and reversing springs out of the piston ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Slide Control Valve and Reversing Springs Out of Piston

step1.para: The valve positioning pin can now be removed from the piston. Remove and discard the seal on the valve positioning pin. Remove the remaining two reversing springs ( Figure 36).

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Valve Positioning Pins and Remaining Reversing Springs

step1.para: Use a 3/16 inch Allen wrench to remove the relief valve seats. There is a slight spring tension on the relief ball valves ( Figure 37).

warning.para: It will be necessary to compress the spring during disassembly. Use care to insure parts are not lost during assembly. Always wear safety glasses to avoid personal injury.

step1.para: The relief passage is drilled through the piston from end to end. There is a ball valve and a valve seat at each end. The ball valves are held against their seats by a spiral spring ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 38. Ball Valves Held Against Seats by Spiral Springs

step1.para: The components of the piston and actuating valve assembly can now be cleaned and inspected. The reversing springs and the relief system parts are the only replaceable parts in the piston. The reversing springs should be flat. Bent or dished springs are an indication of severe impact damages and all components of the steering gear should be inspected for damages ( Figure 39).

figure.caption: Figure 39. Clean and Inspect Components of Piston and Actuating Valve Assembly
